maml:description.maml:para: This command will authenticate to box in the current powershell session

This command will authenticate to box in the current powershell session. You can optionally supply the id of a box user to authenticate to box as the user. When first run, the full path to the json file which should have been obtained when the box app was created in your box environment. You only need to do this once. Please see https://github.com/whiggs/PoshBox for more information on how to obtain this file.

maml:Description.maml:para: The id associated with the user which powershell should authenticate to box as.
The path of the json file containing the box authentication information
The id associated with the user which powershell should authenticate to box as.
The path of the json file containing the box authentication information

maml:alert.maml:para: This command must be run in the powershell session before running any of the other box commands. Also, as mentioned previously, if a user id is supplied to the command, powershell will authenticate to box as the user in question. This is how you will be able to get/manipulate the box environments (files, folders, etc) of other users. This command creates two global variables that are available to the powershell environment when run: $tokenreal and $adminclient. For those who would rather use the box REST API to administrate box instead, the $tokenreal variable is the admin access token that is needed when invoking REST API calls. The $adminclient variable is the "master" object. It is from this one variable that every single other command in this module is built. This object contains all of the methods that can be used to administrate a box environment.

maml:description.maml:para: Invites an existing user to join an Enterprise. The existing user cannot be part of another Enterprise and must already have a Box account. Once invited, the user will receive an email and prompt to accept the invitation within the Box web application. This method requires the "Manage An Enterprise" scope for the enterprise, which can be enabled within your developer console.

The id associated with the webhook which should be updated.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the box webhook associated with the id 7654321 to monitor the box file associated with the id 1234567 for FILE.UPLOADED, FILE.PREVIEWED, FILE.DOWNLOADED, and FILE.TRASHED events.

maml:description.maml:para: Moves all of the owned content from within one user's folder into a new folder in another user's account.

Moves all of the owned content from within one user's folder into a new folder in another user's account. You can move folders across users as long as the you have administrative permissions and the 'source' user owns the folders. To move everything from the root folder, use "0" which always represents the root folder of a Box account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Id associated with the user whose content will be transfered to another user's box account.
The id associated with the user who should receive the content of the specified user's box account
Determines if the destination user should receive email notification of the transfer.
Id associated with the user whose content will be transfered to another user's box account.
Determines if the destination user should receive email notification of the transfer.
The id associated with the user who should receive the content of the specified user's box account

dev:remarks.maml:para: Transfers the content of the box account associated with the user with the id 1234567 to the box account of the user associated with the id 7654321, who is not notified of the transfer.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a lock on a box file
Remove a lock on a box file

maml:Description.maml:para: The id associated with the box file whose lock should be removed
The id associated with the box file whose lock should be removed

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the lock on the box file associated with the id 1234567

maml:description.maml:para: Uploads a provided file to the target parent folder.
Uploads a provided file to the target parent folder. File cannot already exist.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name that should be associated with the file when it is uploaded to box.
The id associated with the box folder in which the uploaded file should be stored.
The full path to the local file to upload.
Attribute(s) to include in the response. To retrieve more information about valid field properties, please see the help content for "about_poshbox"
The timeout value of the upload process.
Attribute(s) to include in the response. To retrieve more information about valid field properties, please see the help content for "about_poshbox"
The name that should be associated with the file when it is uploaded to box.
The id associated with the box folder in which the uploaded file should be stored.
The full path to the local file to upload.
The timeout value of the upload process.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $time = New-Object System.TimeSpan -ArgumentList 0, 15, 0 PS C:\> upload-boxfile -filename "myupload.pdf" -parentdirid 1234567 -path "$env:USERPROFILE\Documents\importantfile.pdf" -timespan $time

dev:remarks.maml:para: Uploads the file located at the path "$env:USERPROFILE\Documents\importantfile.pdf" to the box folder associated with the id 1234567 and renames the file "myupload.pdf".
